definition: private prosecution (law)/(of a patient) to describe (one's symptoms)

sentences.english: The realization of the private prosecution right must be based on the raise of private prosecutors' capability to appeal.
sentences.chinese: 自诉权的实现必须以提升自诉人的控诉能力为基础。

sentences.english: The realization of the private prosecution right must be based on the raise of private prosecutors' capability to appeal.
sentences.chinese: 自诉权的实现必须以提升自诉人的控诉能力为基础。

sentences.english: Cases of private prosecution shall be accepted directly by the people's courts.
sentences.chinese: 自诉案件，由人民法院直接受理。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, private prosecution cases of intellectual properly right are rare in judicial practice.
sentences.chinese: 然而，司法实践中知识产权刑事自诉案件极其罕见。

sentences.english: However, little research has been conducted on the right of private prosecution in criminal litigation.
sentences.chinese: 刑事诉讼法学界对刑事自诉权理论的研究尚不够充分。

sentences.english: She reported no previous history of neck pain or upper-extremity radicular symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 患者自诉既往无颈痛或上肢的神经根症状。

sentences.english: The accused in a private prosecution has the right to entrust defenders at any time.
sentences.chinese: 自诉案件的被告人有权随时委托辩护人。

definition: to recount in one's own words/autobiography/written self-introduction
to see a doctor/to seek medical advice
to register (to an official organism)/to file a case (for investigation)
to sue/to bring a lawsuit against/to prosecute
common plea/civil appeal (as opposed to criminal case)
